steps.title: The Black Cape gives you +5% damage, +100 health, and +100 energy.
steps.content: The Black Cape gives you +5% damage, +100 health, and +100 energy. It's a rare accessory that you can purchase from Parlus at Marine Fortress for $50,000 at level 50+. [1] X Research source Even though the cape is actually a dark grey, it is called the Black Cape. This is one of the easiest accessories to acquire, being relatively inexpensive and purchasable after level 50.

steps.title: Buy it for $50,000 from Parlus at Marine Fortress.
steps.content: Buy it for $50,000 from Parlus at Marine Fortress. You have to be level 50 or above. You can find Parlus on the Marine Fortress island, which is located behind the Marine starter island. To find this NPC, go to the island and head to the docks near the boat dealer NPC. Turn right from the boat dealer NPC to a watch tower. Climb the watchtower (you need high jumping abilities since the steps are long). Fruits like the Rocket and Bomb Fruits let you jump high with explosive abilities. Once on top of the tower, jump into the tunnel on the floor to get inside, where you'll see Parlus, who sells the Black Cape.

steps.title: It's very good for grinding.
steps.content: It's very good for grinding. Even though the enemies in the First Sea aren't too difficult, the buffs from this cape are very beneficial for someone still fighting in that area. It allows you to stay in combat longer (+100 energy and +100 health) and get a damage boost (+5% damage). This is a perfect accessory for a newer player above level 50. Pros : Great for new players Compatible with any build Cheap and reliable Moderate universal damage increase Cons : Need to be level 50 to buy the cape No movement speed buff

steps.title: Black Spikey Coat.
steps.content: Black Spikey Coat. Get this coat by defeating Jeremy, the boss in the Kingdom of Rose in the Second Sea. You get +7.5% damage, +200 energy, +200 health. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dark Coat.
steps.content: Dark Coat. Obtain this coat by defeating Darkbeard, who is a level 1000 raid boss. You get +15% damage, +600 energy, +600 health. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pink Coat.
steps.content: Pink Coat. Get this coat by beating the Swan Boss in the Prison of First Sea. Get +10% Gun damage, +200 health. If you aren't sure which to use, know that the Pink Coat only buffs the damage from Guns. So if you're looking for a damage boost if you're using a sword, this accessory won't help you.

steps.title: Marine Cap.
steps.content: Marine Cap. As a Marine, get it from any Pirate the First, Second, or Third Sea as long as your honor is above 250,000 You get +7.5% damage on Sword/Gun attacks, 10% cooldown reduction on Sword/Gun attacks.

steps.title: Marine Coat (aka Coat).
steps.content: Marine Coat (aka Coat). You have a 5% chance of getting it by defeating the Vice Admiral located in Marine Fortress at First Sea. The coat gives you +10% melee damage, +200 energy. If you're a Fruit main, the cape might be better for you.
